OOP Principles.title: Which of the following best describes encapsulation?

answers.answer: Hiding the internal details and exposing only necessary parts
Allowing unrestricted access to all members

OOP Principles.title: What is polymorphism in object-oriented programming?

answers.answer: The ability to process objects differently based on their data type
Defining multiple methods with different names
Forcing a class to inherit from multiple base classes

OOP Principles.title: What is the purpose of abstraction in OOP?

answers.answer: To hide complex implementation details and expose only relevant functionality
To make all members of a class public
To allow multiple classes to inherit from one base class

OOP Principles.title: Which of the following is NOT an OOP principle?

answers.answer: Hiding implementation details and exposing only necessary parts
Using multiple classes to achieve a goal
The ability to define multiple methods with the same name
Restricting access to certain variables only within a method
The ability to take many forms
